channel.title: RuneScape 481 Player and NPC Update Masks
channel.description:
Yeah, I need help finding them..Sorry if this isn't the topic you where probably thinking of but yeah I'm just having a bit of a problem when searching for these. I'm not expecting any of you to directly tell me where they are but, I would appreciate if I was somehow pointed in the right direction as to finding them. I know that Class47 (I think...don't flame me if it's wrong) deals with Player/NPC Update Masks and many other things but my main concern as of now is to find the Player/NPC Masks and handle them serverside so that when I log-in I see an actual player model, not an invisible one. And on a side note, where would the loading of the chatbox be located? like loading the arrows on the right side of the chatbox, the line above the username, and the little asterisk thing and again I'm not expecting any of you to directly tell me where it is butort of direction or help with it I will appreciate. Thanks for reading and hopefully you won't give a person who is just getting the grasp of Java and it's properties a hard time.
(I know that person who is just learning or "grasping" at Java shoukdn't be undertaking a project like this, but I have some friends who have worked with 481 before and have guided me through how the client loads, connects, sends packets, etc and I am learning new things every day.)
After a night of searching, I think I have found Player Updating...it's Opcode 254 (I THINK). If someone can confirm this, that will be great.
And after using RSbot and it's InterfaceExplorer, I believe I found all that I need related to the Chatbox and alll of the other interfaces like Eqipment, Inventory, Stats, etc. Thanks Qauters for the help.
3 posts and 35 views? :\
All I need to know now if the player updating opcode is correct is the NPC Update Mask which I'm sure I can probably find on my own.
Oh and if this is somehow in the wrong section, sorry...I didn't really find anyother section that was suitable for this except for this section.

item.title: RuneScape 481 Player and NPC Update Masks
item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:8, topic:215581”][quote author=light232 link=topic=283358.msg2310206#msg2310206 date=1215021650]

Thanks Qauters, I’ll look into that but I’m still having problems finding the masks if I can find those masks and see what they send to the server I can handle them serverside. I know there in Class47 somewhere and it’s subclasses, but to me this is like a big game of Hide and Seek…there hidden somewhere and I need to find them if I ever want to progress.

i have the masks…all of them…do you know how to implement into the server?
[/quote]Do you really think he would know how without having the ability to identify those masks? Of course not![/quote]
rofl…i used blank wl update mask code (with 481 update masks values) and almost have rendering done

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 481 Player and NPC Update Masks
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

And on a side note, where would the loading of the chatbox be located? like loading the arrows on the right side of the chatbox, the line above the username, and the little asterisk thing and again I'm not expecting any of you to directly tell me where it is butort of direction or help with it I will appreciate.
The chatbox is an interface, so you have to see where it loads the interfaces. RSBot with InterfaceExplorer can be a great help to find the interface id's. Interface 137 is chat box related, child interface would be your name + text etc. (Like Qauters:Hello World!*) Child 55 is scrollbar. The interface also contains the info related to the GE.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape 481 Player and NPC Update Masks

@HeWhoOpensADoor wrote:

yes, I know but I mainly posted here because 1. there are more Java experts here at Moparisthebest than Mopar.org save Miss Silab and a few others I believe 2. It’s more client related then server related at the moment and since this is a 481 client it wouldn’t fit in the 317 client hacking section that is at Mopar.org and 3. well, if this is in the wrong spot/site you can lock or delete it if you want and I’ll take it over to to Mopar.org
